Articles.Content:
Well, sort of. http://what-if.xkcd.com/68/

Hover your mouse over the second bottom picture and you'll see a reference to us!

Is Randall one of us?

To flesh it out a bit, the What If? was about what would happen if there was an asteroid with Earth's gravity and when you take off what strange orbits it would produce.

Edited October 22, 2013 by Octobomb

There are quite a few KSP references in XKCD, both in the what-ifs and in the comics.

I love the line though, "This is KSP on nightmare mode."
The best Kerbal related XKCD was 'The six words you never say at NASA'

To flesh it out a bit, the What If? was about what would happen if there was an asteroid with Earth's gravity and when you take off what strange orbits it would produce.

In the KSP universe, gravity only acts on objects' centers-of-mass, so there would be no strange orbits. And we're already answering this question to a degree: Kerbin is 10x smaller than the Earth by radius, yet has the same surface gravity.

The six words at Nasa: http://xkcd.com/1244/

This one's hidden in the title text (mouseover): http://www.xkcd.com/1106/

Maybe Randall is one of us!

But if

then surely when you do

You would be at the `50% gravity` part so there would be a slower escape velocity than 5m/s?

In fact, depending on the rotational period, you might get escape velocity on the top of a ladder...

Or the top parts of you anyway...

Edited October 22, 2013 by John FX

I think I have lived that nightmare, trying to dock at a station orbiting minmus.

alacrity

Talk about Gilly encounters.
This post predates KSP by a few years and is a reference to Little Prince. That being said Randall did mention us much more recently

No. This is from today.

There are quite a few KSP references in XKCD, both in the what-ifs and in the comics.

I love the line though, "This is KSP on nightmare mode."

The line is wrong though.

It's on beginners mode
I wonder if he is on this forum.
The "six words you never hear at NASA" comic was how I discovered KSP actually.

The "six words you never hear at NASA" comic was how I discovered KSP actually.

I discovered it through the 'ADD' strip. Yay! xkcd buddies!

I wonder if he is on this forum.

Now, that would be fun!

< XKCD fanboy mode>

Randall posts on the KSP forums would surely be very ... interesting.

I would be very curious to see how Randall Munroe plays KSP. Or see him interact with Scott Manley or Danny...

< /XKCD fanboy mode>

EDIT : to keep up with the long chain of people introduced to KSP thanks to a certain webcomic "of romance,

sarcasm, math, and language", it's also the 'ADD' strip that led me to type 3 innocent looking letters in google...
